{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3491521,"name":"","username":"Matheus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T12:45:32.898Z","cooked":"

Hi guys, recently I’ve been having a very annoying problem with the swerve, we configured the PID everything correctly, but when we rotate the swerve a lot it ends up shifting its orientation a little (in arena orientation mode) something that is also seen by us in odometry we see in advantageScope, any tips on what to do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T12:45:32.898Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":30,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":174.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483366,"topic_slug":"swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64053,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl/483366/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3491575,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T14:30:30.194Z","cooked":"

Is your Translational Axis changing based off of Robot Orientation?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T14:30:30.194Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":28.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483366,"topic_slug":"swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl/483366/2","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491614,"name":"","username":"Matheus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T15:19:14.696Z","cooked":"

no, it is oriented towards the arena, however when we rotate the robot very quickly, it is as if what it perceives as the front moves, all of this being visualized by the advantage scope, while we physically align the robot, in the simulation it has a deviation of rotation, causing when I throw the joystick forward it goes diagonally

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T15:19:14.696Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483366,"topic_slug":"swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64053,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-problem-orientation-yagsl/483366/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491620,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T15:22:51.677Z","cooked":"

When your start your robot then go froward, backward, left, right
THEN you rotate your robot 90degrees then go forward, backward, left, right.

Are they the same forward, backwards, left, right?

IGNORING ODOM. I am talking about real life

We did the tests, and the deviation occurs in real life too, it goes diagonally when we put it to go forward after rotating the robot a lot

a gyroscope has a calibration called the “scale factor” which can lead to this sort of problem if it’s wrong.

if you “unwind” the rotations, does the problem reverse itself?

what gyro are you using?

fascinating.

does it happen if you rotate more slowly? does it happen proportionally to the rotation speed?

are you ever correcting the gyro based on the odometry? or do you leave the gyro alone? what does the raw gyro signal say?

They might be experiencing a problem that was in the earlier versions this year and need to update to 2025.2.2; but I can’t confirm this without a video and a link to their code.

I had used the wrong units for the feedforward calculation for the drive motors (inches instead of meters)

stemosofc/Swerve-stemOS_Java-2025/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/pidfproperties.json#L2-L14


      
    
          
  1. "drive": {
    2. 
          
  2.   "p": 0.00023,
    3. 
          
  3.   "i": 0.0000002,
    4. 
          
  4.   "d": 1,
    5. 
          
  5.   "f": 0,
    6. 
          
  6.   "iz": 0
    7. 
          
  7. },
    8. 
          
  8. "angle": {
    9. 
          
  9.   "p": 0.0020645,
    10. 
          
  10.   "i": 0,
    11. 
          
  11.   "d": 0,
    12. 
          
  12.   "f": 0.001,
    13. 
          
  13.   "iz": 0
    14.

And set this line to null

github.com

stemosofc/Swerve-stemOS_Java-2025/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/swervedrive.json#L6


      
    
          
  1. {
    2. 
          
  2.   "$schema": "https://broncbotz3481.github.io/YAGSL-Example/schemas/swervedrive_schema.json",
    3. 
          
  3.   "imu": {
    4. 
          
  4.     "type": "pigeon2",
    5.

    6.

    7. 
          
  7.   },

    14.

What gyro are you using? A pigeon2, navx, canandgyro?

I do not see anything wrong in that video. Can you try to articulate your problem better?

Your odometry is a bit off but that can be fixed. I think you have the wrong gearRatio or your treads do not measure 4in here.

github.com

Matheus9484/TesteSwerve2025/blob/master/Swerve2025/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/physicalproperties.json#L4


      
    
          
  1. {
    2. 
          
  2.   "conversionFactors": {
    3. 
          
  3.   "angle": {"gearRatio": 21.4285714286},
    4. 
          
  4.   "drive": {"gearRatio": 6.75, "diameter": 4}
    5. 
          
  5. },
    6. 
          
  6.   "currentLimit": {
    7. 
          
  7.     "drive": 40,
    8. 
          
  8.     "angle": 20
    9. 
          
  9.   },
    10. 
          
  10.   "rampRate": {
    11. 
          
  11.     "drive": 0.1,
    12. 
          
  12.     "angle": 0.1
    13. 
          
  13.   },
    14. 
          
  14.   "wheelGripCoefficientOfFriction": 1.19,
    15.

Or you did not use enough significant digits. These small things add up. For example if your absolute encoder offset doesn’t use enough significant digits this can easily happen too.

If you’re sure this isn’t your problem you should try tuning your discretization then angular velocity compensation. Both of these values WILL change whenver you add or remove ANYTHING from the robot
